event.name: The Minimalist Jug Band features at the Vancouver Poetry Slam
event.description:
The Vancouver Poetry Slam is very proud to have the Minimalist Jug Band feature on this, our 3rd qualifying Slam of the season AND the birthday of the evening's host, our International Slammaster, Duncan Shields.
The minimalist jug band is a one man beatnik punk-a-billy band act that's been dragging its carcass across the continent performing at various festivals since the last ice age. This low down high-strung washed up guy on a washtub bass plucks at his own heart strings ,performing material that ranges from darkly comic to comically dark. His most recent c.d. 'thrift stories' can be heard on your more interesting radio program or on cbc.
Doors and Sign Up are at 8:00PM
Open Mic 8:45 PM
Slam 9:00 PM
Cover is $5-10 sliding scale

event.name: Dan Mangan (Vancouver/ Kanada)
event.description:
Der NME schrieb über Dan Mangan: "This folk singer may only be 23, but he sings with the soul of Woody Guthrie - if Woody Guthrie had listened to Godspeed (You Black Emperor)." Inzwischen ist Dan 25 und die Presse überschlägt sich förmlich, wenn es um sein letztes Album "Nice, Nice, Very Nice" geht. Ich verstehe haargenau, warum alle so begeistert sind. Dan Managan ist ein großartiger, scharfer Beobachter mit umwerfendem Humor, der in seinen Songs über Roboter, Indie-Mädchen und Tina Turners Comeback genau den richtigen Ton trifft und seine Figuren niemals der Lächerlichkeit preis-, sondern sie stattdessen mit wunderbaren Melodien umgibt. Eine wahre Entdeckung.
http://www.danmanganmusic.com
http://www.myspace.com/danmangan

event.name: Vancouver Cancuks regular season tickets for sale
event.tagline: Premium Club Seats..Tons of games available
event.description:
Vancouver Canucks single game ticket sales...see games below.. all game are in the same section and seats.. sold is pairs
Section 105 (club section) - You get your own parking, service at your seat. No having to get up out of your seat to get a beer!
Row 7 - Very close to the ice with a great view
Seats 103/104 - These seats are on the aisle so when the waitress comes down you get first service!
More dates will become available as the months roll along so if you're looking for a certain game it just might come up. Below are the dates and our opponent for the night. Prices are subject to change. No low ball offers. Premium games will cost more. Weekday games are cheaper
Oct 24/09 - Maple Leafs - $700 - SOLD
Oct 25/09 - Oilers - $500
Nov 1/09 - Avalanche - $450
Nov 20/09 - Avalanche - $450
Nov 28/09 - Oilers - $500
Dec 12/09 - Wild - $450 - SOLD
Dec 18/09 - Capitals - NOT FOR SALE IM GOING! Haha
Dec 20/09 - Blues - $400
Dec 22/09 - Predators - $400
Dec 26/09 - Oilers - $400 (Boxing Day Sale) - SOLD
Jan 16/09 - Penguins - $750
Mar 13/09 - Senators - $650

event.name: Vancouver Launch of GUERRILLA DIPLOMACY
event.tagline: A special evening with Daryl Copeland, author of the highly acclaimed book Guerrilla Diplomacy.
event.description:
--------------------------------------------
A SPECIAL BOOK LAUNCH
The SFU Centre for Dialogue, School for International Studies, Canada's World and CIC Vancouver invite you to a special evening with Daryl Copeland, author of the highly acclaimed book Guerrilla Diplomacy.
With increasing recognition now given to the notion that international security is dependent on progress and stability in the developing world, former Canadian diplomat Daryl Copeland argues in his new book Guerilla Diplomacy that development should replace defence as the key consideration at the centre of national foreign policies. Copeland offers both a call to action and an alternative approach to understanding contemporary international relations.
--------------------------------------------
THE BOOK
“A tour de force…. Refreshing, insightful, innovative…. Finally, a new generation of diplomacy for a new generation of students of diplomacy.”
—R.S. Zaharna, American University
“When diplomacy’s current revolution is recorded in the history books, Copeland’s extraordinarily compelling and prescient work will be acknowledged as one of the milestones of this turbulent period.”
—Simon Anholt, UK Foreign Office Public Diplomacy Board
"With its holistic approach, the book is... a tool for navigation through a complex and intertwined system of multiple actors, levels, and problems -- and a guideline for advancing the role of diplomacy in a changed world."
-- Katharina Höne, Diplo Foundation
--------------------------------------------
HOW TO ATTEND
Join us for this event on November 29, 7:00pm at the SFU Harbour Centre (Room 1400), located at 515 W. Hastings St.
Refreshments will be served.
Please RSVP to ensure your seat by signing up at http://websurvey.sfu.ca/survey/43458593
or by contacting Linda at ugsid@sfu.ca.
--------------------------------------------
ABOUT THE AUTHOR
Daryl Copeland is a Canadian analyst, writer and educator who writes and speaks extensively as an independent scholar on issues of international policy, global issues, diplomacy and public management.
From 1981 – 2009 Daryl served as a Canadian diplomat with postings abroad in Thailand, Ethiopia, New Zealand and Malaysia. Among his positions at the Department of Foreign Affairs and International Trade in Ottawa, Mr. Copeland worked as Deputy Director for International Communications; Director for Southeast Asia; Senior Advisor, Public Diplomacy; Director of Strategic Communications Services and; Senior Advisor, Strategic Policy and Planning. Daryl is currently on academic leave from the diplomatic service, seconded to the University of Southern California Centre on Public Diplomacy and the University of Toronto’s Munk Centre for International Studies.
For more information, see Copeland's web site and blog at www.guerrilladiplomacy.com.
--------------------------------------------
